metadata.title: CVE-2018-16872 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in qemu Media Transfer Protocol (MTP). The code openingfiles in usb_mtp_get_object and usb_mtp_get_partial_object and directoriesin usb_mtp_object_readdir doesn't consider that the underlying filesystemmay have changed since the time lstat(2) was called inusb_mtp_object_alloc, a classical TOCTTOU problem. An attacker with writeaccess to the host filesystem shared with a guest can use this property tonavigate the host filesystem in the context of the QEMU process and readany file the QEMU process has access to. Access to the filesystem may belocal or via a network share protocol such as CIFS.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16872` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.12
qemu-block-extra - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.12
qemu-guest-agent - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.12
qemu-kvm - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.12
qemu-system - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.12
qemu-system-arm - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.12
qemu-system-common - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.12
qemu-system-mips - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.12
qemu-system-misc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.12
qemu-system-ppc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.12
qemu-system-s390x - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.12
qemu-system-sparc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.12
qemu-system-x86 - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.12
qemu-user - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.12
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.12
qemu-user-static - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.12
qemu-utils - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.12
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.12').
